location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 195: Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Acting Political Agent in Turkish Arabia, Bagdad

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: Some of the right side of this folio has worn away slightly. Parts of words are missing but not to the extent to prevent understanding of the content.

mods.abstract: In this letter Samuel Hennell thanks Arnold Burrowes Kemball for his despatch dated 23 April 1850 (see ff 5-7), which announced the appointment of Maashook Pasha to the Government of Bussorah [Basra], and for bringing to his notice his suspicions regarding the Pasha's plans relating to the Arabian shores.
